Name: 3D BAG
Description: 3D buildings of the Netherlands

Name: AHN 4
Description: AHN 4 version of the Netherlands digital elevation model dataset

Name: AHN Viewer
Description: Height map of the Netherlands

Name: All Maps Viewer
Description: 100,000s of maps are available through IIIF, across libraries, archives and museums worldwide. Allmaps makes it easier and more inspiring to curate, georeference and explore collections of digitized maps.

Name: ArcGIS Living Atlas of the World
Description: ArcGIS Living Atlas of the World is the foremost collection of geographic information from around the globe. It includes maps, apps, and data layers to support your work.

Name: BBBike
Description: Provides shapefiles and raw OSM format for cities around the world, extracted weekly. This is useful if you are looking for data extracts for a single city.

Name: Bodemdata
Description: This website contains current information on soil, terrain form and groundwater levels in the Netherlands, collected by Wageningen Environmental Research in the Soil Information System (BIS) Nederland.

Name: Corine Land cover
Description: European Land Cover Database generated by the Land Monitoring Core Service (LMCS) of Copernicus, the European flagship programme on Earth Observation

Name: DINOloket
Description: Subsurface data

Name: EarthStat
Description: EarthStat serves geographic data sets that help solve the grand challenge of feeding a growing global population while reducing agriculture’s impact on the environment.

Name: FAO Hand-in-Hand Geospatial Platform
Description: This Digital Public Good provides open-access geographic information, key food security indicators and agricultural statistics sourced from FAO and from external organizations such as NGOs, academia, the private sector, and space agencies.
Theme/data: Food Security Indicators and Agricultural statistics

Name: GBFS
Description:
Documentation for the General Bikeshare Feed Specification, a
 standardized data feed for shared mobility system availability

Name: Geofabrik
Description: Provides OpenStreetMap extracts prepared in either PBF or shapefile format for download daily.

Name: Geospatial Conservation Atlas
Description: Includes web maps, apps, a map gallery, local initiative portals, conservation data, and other resources.

Name: Global Forest Change
Description: Results from time-series analysis of Landsat images characterizing forest extent and change.

Name: Global Forest Watch
Description: Global forest monitoring

Name: GMNS
Description: General Modeling Network Specification

Name: GTFS Realtime Overview
Description:
GTFS Realtime is a feed specification that allows public transportation 
agencies to provide realtime updates about their fleet to application 
developers

Name: GTFS Static Overview
Description:
The General Transit Feed Specification (GTFS), also known as GTFS 
static or static transit to differentiate it from the GTFS realtime extension,
 defines a common format for public transportation schedules and 
associated geographic information.

Name: Hydrosheds
Description: Hydro-environmental data

Name: Kerncijfers per postcode (CBS)
Description: CBS provides key figures at a low regional level. This concerns data for the full postal code (PC6), 5 positions of the postal code (PC5) and the numerical part of the postal code (PC4). A series of demographic and socio-economic variables are associated with each area.

Name: Local Climate Zones
Description: LCZ maps generated with the LCZ Generator. Only the best result per author and city is displayed in this table.

Name: MDS
Description:
A data standard to enable right-of-way regulation and two-way 
communication between mobility companies and local governments.

Name: MTLFS
Description: Proposal for a standard format for specifying Managed and Tolled Lanes

Name: Nasa Earth Data
Description: The Earth Science Data Systems (ESDS) Program provides full and open access to NASA’s collection of Earth science data.

Name: National Centers for Environmental Information
Description: Maps and data from across scientific disciplines, formats, time periods, and locations

Name: Natural Earth Data
Description: Natural Earth is a public domain map dataset available at 1:10m, 1:50m, and 1:110 million scales. Featuring tightly integrated vector and raster data, with Natural Earth you can make a variety of visually pleasing, well-crafted maps with cartography or GIS software.

Name: NEO Active Fires
Description: Maps showing locations of actively burning fires around the world, detected by instruments aboard NASA satellites

Name: NeTEx
Description:
NeTEx is a CEN Technical Standard for exchanging Public Transport 
schedules and related data

Name: Open Street Map
Description: OpenStreetMap is the free wiki world map. This collaborative project is one of the largest databases of volunteered geographic information in the world. Its contents include points of interest, routable networks, and other geodata.

Name: OSM Extracts
Description: Each day, OSM Extracts by Interline mirrors the entire OpenStreetMap planet and creates city and region sized extracts ready for download into formats ready for GIS.

Name: OverpassTurbo
Description: Overpass Turbo is a web-based data mining tool for OpenStreetMap. It runs any kind of Overpass API query, shows the results on an interactive map, and allows users to export query data in the form of GeoJSON files (which may be converted to Shapefiles). It also provides helpful support for new users in the form of the "Wizard" tool. Using Overpass Turbo, you can query virtually any location globally using dedicated tags in Open Street Map.

Name: Provincie Zuid-Holland, bodematlas
Description: Soil atlas of the Netherlands

Name: Resource Watch
Description: Resource Watch features hundreds of data sets all in one place on the state of the planet’s resources and citizens

Name: Shared-row
Description:
This is an open data specification for describing the right-of-way (ROW)
 for street centerline networks. It is intended to establish a common set 
of attributes (schema) to describe how space is allocated along a streets right of way from sidewalk edge to sidewalk edge.

Name: SharedStreets
Description: SharedStreets connects information about the street across jurisdictions, companies and governments through open sourcesoftware, digital  infrastructure and governance frameworks to enable public-private collaboration and the seamless exchange of transport data
Theme/data: Information about Streets and Transport data

Name: Shiny Weather Data
Description: Climate data (historical series)

Name: SIRI
Description:
SIRI is a CEN Technical Standard that specifies a European interface
standard for exchanging information about the planned, current or 
projected performance of real-time public transport operations between
different computer systems.
Theme/data: Real trime data for public transport operations

Name: Story Maps
Description: Base map of the Netherlands Natural System
